content: priha pattern and photos tiina kuu priha is a unisex cuff down sock design that features easy stranded colourwork both in the leg and foot the stranded patterns are inspired by traditional karelian handicrafts priha is karelian language meaning a youngster in english this is the revised version in which the jog often seen at the beginning of the round in stranded colourwork has been somewhat faded yarn and yardage main colour mc ikke yak sock 70 % merino 20 % yak 10 % nylon 400 m / 100 g size 60-80 grams of dark grey steele colourway there are instructions for sizes small 64 sts contrast colour cc nettilanka fi lumoava medium/large 72 sts and extra-large 80 sts luksus ohut sukka 75 % merino 25 % nylon which are referred to in the instructions as s 400 m / 100 g 15-20 grams of light green m/l xl if only one stitch count is given it kevät colourway applies to all sizes sizes s m/l xl fit foot any fingering weight yarns can be used circumference of approximately 19 21 5 24 cm / 7½ 8½ 9½ inches with some negative ease gauge 36 sts and 48 row in stockinette with smaller before you start needles = 10 cm / 4 inches please read the instructions carefully the 36 sts and 36 row in stranded colourwork beginning of the round bor is at the with larger needles = 10 cm / 4 inches beginning of needle 1 the front of the leg and instep are worked on needle 1 the back of the leg heel gussets needles and sole are worked on needle 2 at least 80 cm / 32 inch long circular needles charts are to be read from right to left and 2 0 mm / us½ and 2 5 mm / us1½ or suitable bottom up to obtain gauge the socks can be knitted with dpns two shorter circulars or a mini circular but the instructions have been written for magic loop priha socks page 1/4 instructions chart a cuff with the main colour mc and smaller needles co 64 72 80 sts distribute sts as follows 33 37 41 sts onto needle 1 i e the beginning of the round and 31 35 39 sts onto needle 2 i e the end of the round join to begin working in the round being careful not to twist work *p1 k3* ribbing for 16 rounds or to desired cuff length leg knit one round at the end of the round m1l there are now 33 37 41 sts on needle 1 and 32 36 40 sts on needle 2 switch to larger needles if desired and attach chart key the contrast colour cc work according to chart a as follows work sts 1-8 a total of 7 8 9 times and finally work sts 9-17 once after finishing chart a row 25 cut cc switch to smaller needles if desired and knit until 2 sts remain
